title: New: Mink – Yearning and Optomism / One For You (The Knife Cover)
content:
First off, yes, I do realise that ‘optimism’ is spelled incorrectly, but frankly who cares whether it’s intentional or not, as the music more than makes up for any grammatical issues.

These two debut tracks from Seattle electronic artist Mink are six and a half minutes of ambient, trance inducing beauty. Opening with a cover of The Knife’s psychedelic track One For You, and morphing it into a gorgeously minimal vocal driven gem, it’s clear from the off that Mink has talent.

Second track Yearning and Optomism is less atmospheric, and follows a fairly standard electronic structure, but pulls if off elegantly, with the swirling layered vocals proving a particular highlight. As with much of the new music on CitR, I’m yet to find out too much about this Seattle artist, but I’m extremely excited to hear more from her.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
